channel.title: 30th Annual Couchiching conference, 1961
channel.description:
The 1961 Couchiching Conference, a summer symposium on national and international affairs put together by the Canadian Institute on Public Affairs and the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, assembles for its 30th annual meeting. The theme of the 1961 conference was "diplomacy in evolution."

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Diplomacy in Evolution: Sovereignty and international control
item.description: The sixth episode of the conference focuses on Canadian sovereignty, international relations, and the policy of interdependence.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Diplomacy in Evolution: Realities of war
item.description: The fourth program from the 1961 conference focuses on modern war and its effects on society. Dr. Henry Kissinger is the featured speaker.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Diplomacy in Evolution: Independence and the developing states
item.description: The third program from the 1961 conference focuses on independence, nationalism, and developing countries.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Diplomacy in Evolution: Technology and the developing states
item.description: The second program from the 1961 conference focuses on technology and developing countries and features a speech by French economist and politician AndrÃ© Philip, who addresses the challenges of imposing new technologies on old societies.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Diplomacy in Evolution: Realities of disarmament
item.description: The fifth episode of the 1961 conference includes a speech by Sir Geoffrey Bourne as well as a panel discussion on disarmament.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Diplomacy in Evolution: Opening address
item.description: The first episode contained the conference's opening address by Scottish author, journalist, and academic Ritchie Calder, who addressed the impact of instant communications on international relations and participated in a subsequent question and answer session.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Diplomacy in Evolution: Canada's role in international relations
item.description: The seventh and final episode of the conference focuses on Canada's role in world politics. The main speaker is the Premier of Manitoba, Duff Roblin.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: World Politics
